moves.2... exf4: As a man of honor, Philidor accepts.
moves.3. Nf3: A sure way to prevent a Black counterattack of ...Q-R5 ch, always a danger in the King's Gambit.
moves.4. Bc4: Naturally, Atwood goes after the weakness at KB7.
moves.6... Nc6: Philidor hastens to begin his own development and consolidate his position.
moves.7... Qf6: Adding a defender to the KB2 square.
moves.9. Kd1: I must be missing something here. Why is 9 PxQ a bad move? I can't imagine Atwood overlooking it, or Philidor missing it when he played his previous move.
moves.9... Qf6: Having forced Atwood's King to move, the Queen retreats.
moves.10. Re1+: Down a piece and a Pawn, Atwood must attack.
moves.10... Be7: Philidor cuts him off at the pass.
moves.11... d6: Enabling the QB to move folowed by O-O-O. With his attack gone and down a piece without compensation, Atwood resigns.
